IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To accelerate solutions for a stable climate, sustainable resources, and fair economies.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To accelerate solutions for a stable climate, sustainable resources, and fair economies.
IRS990.Desc: Economic Law and Policy; Our experts focus on areas of economic policy making that are essential to sustainable development, including investment, trade public procurement and infrastructure and sustainability standards.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Resilience; Our multidisciplinary team of policy researchers work with governments, civil society, communities and businesses to help them manage climate and conflict related risks.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Energy; Our experts offer practical guidance to help authorities choose the right system of electricity generation, reduce consumption of fossil based transport fuels, and implement international climate change commitments.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: The remaining program areas are comprised of Water Policy, Experimental Lakes Area, Climate, Tracking Progress and Program Development.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is completed by the Treasurer and CFO with the support of the Controller

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All employees must sign the conflict of interest policy as part of their employment agreement with IISD and again every 2 years during their employment tenure. The board of directors are required to sign annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Audit Commitee of the Board of Directors reviews and reports to the Board on executive compensation. The mandate of the committee is to conduct a review of IISD's Senior Employee compensation arrangements. Management annually provides the committee and the full board a document indicating the total compensation paid to each employee on an annual basis for senior staff compensation. The scope of the review includes both elements of the compensation packages and the process by which compensation rates are determined for corporate officers. Members of the committee focus on determining existence and evaluating appropriateness of benchmarks used to validate compensation ranges, the method by which rates are determined and the elements of the compensation package. The Executive Committee of the board of directors reviews the performance of the CEO annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IISD does not make available to the public any of its governing documents or its conflict of interest policy. They are all available on IISD's internal Intranet system. The audited consolidated financial statements are available on IISD's website.

Adjustment due to FX change between fiscal years. Opening net assets at 1.2496 CAD/USD at March 31, 2022 vs 1.3533 CAD/USD at March 31, 2023. Net Assets March 31, 2023 $9,646,731 CAD @ 1.3533 = $7,128,302 - $9,646,731@1.2496 = $7,719,855, difference is $591,553 USD.
